intro: Allotoonia agglutinata, commonly known as the sticky nightshade, is a shrub native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other nightshades such as tomatoes and potatoes. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale purple. Its fruit is a fleshy, berry-like structure that contains several seeds. Due to its sticky secretions, it is sometimes referred to as a source of natural adhesives.
